com.paypal.merchant.sdk.domain
Interface Merchant

All Superinterfaces:
PayPalUser
public interface Merchant
extends PayPalUser

The Merchant object is an integral part of the SDK and acts as a single point from which all information about the
merchant is available both to the application and also internally to the SDK.
Although not provided as a parameter explicitly in every API the merchant object is critical to the workings of the
SDK. Internally, the SDK keeps track of the currently active merchant on behalf of whom all the operations are
carried out.
A Valid merchant object consists of the following pieces of information:
1) Merchant Email address
2) Merchant Address
3) Merchant Phone Number
4) Merchant's business info
5) Merchant's CurrencyCode
6) Credentials(OAuth access token, refresh url and expiry)
Together, these define the details that the SDK needs to be able to successfully operate on behalf of the merchant<
When the SDK is initialized, the application provides the Credentials that were obtained through OAuth processes
after which the current merchant can be obtained at all times using the PayPalHereSDK.getActiveMerchant() API.
In addition, this class has a bunch of utility APIs that can be useful for the application at various times.

Nested Class Summary
static class Merchant.AvailabilityTypeEnum
          This enum type indicates the availability status of the merchant, whether he/she is open or closed for business.
static class Merchant.MobilityTypeEnum
          This enum type indicates whether the merchant is at a fixed location or is mobile.

Method Detail

getPaymentLimits

PaymentLimits getPaymentLimits()
method to get the payment limits that is set for this merchant.

Returns:
: a PaymentLimits object that contains such info as min charge accepted, max charge accepted and if a signature is required to complete the transaction.

getMerchantStatus

String getMerchantStatus()
Return's the status of the merchant account. When setting the merchant credentials the SDK performs a PayPal /status call for this merchant and parses the returned information. That 'status' is exposed via this getMerchantStatus() call and indicates if your account is ready/allowed to accept payments.

Returns:

getAllowedPaymentTypes

List<String> getAllowedPaymentTypes()
Return the payment types allowed by this merchant account. When setting the merchant credentials the SDK performs a PayPal /status call for this merchant and parses the returned information. One of the items parsed is the list of allowed payment types for this account. That 'list' is exposed via this getAllowedPaymentTypes() call. Examples of items in the list can be 'card' and/or 'tab' (checkin)

Returns:

getBusinessName

String getBusinessName()
method to retrieve the business name for the merchant

Returns:
String that contains the business name

setBusinessName

void setBusinessName(String businessName)
method to set the business name of the merchant.

Parameters:
businessName - : a suitable name of your business such as "Joe's Pizza" etc.

getLogoUrl

String getLogoUrl()
retrieve the url of the logo

Returns:
Url in the form of a string. If no logo was set this will return a null value and should be handled by
the caller

setLogoUrl

void setLogoUrl(String logoUrl)
method to set the logo url that would be displayed to all the customers who are checked into your store.

Parameters:
logoUrl - : an url string.

getAddress

Address getAddress()
method to get the address information of the merchant. Note that the address is returned as a formatted Address object
which is defined in com.paypal.sdk.domain.Address

Returns:
Address

setAddress

void setAddress(Address address)
method to set the address information of a merchant.

Parameters:
address - : Address object that contains all the relevant address information of the merchant.

getMerchantCurrency

Currency getMerchantCurrency()
Get the default currency used for payments for this merchant.

Returns:
: Currency object that describes the currency in use.

setMerchantCurrency

void setMerchantCurrency(Currency currency)
method to set the currency to be used for all the transactions performed by this merchant.

Parameters:
currency - : Currency object.

getCheckedInMerchant

CheckedInMerchantLocation getCheckedInMerchant()
Returns an object that contains various information about the checked in merchant, such as, location id, lat, long etc.

Returns:
CheckedInMerchantLocation object, that if present, indicates that the merchant is checked in and is able to take in-store payments via checked in customers. If not checked in, this method would return a null.

getInternalName

String getInternalName()
Returns the internal name of merchant. The internal name is a unique name for a merchant is useful while merchant checkins. If a merchant wants to be checked into multiple locations, the internal names across those locations should be different and unique.

Returns:
: a unique internal name string.

setInternalName

void setInternalName(String internalName)
method to set the internal name.

NOTE: Currently, the SDK sets the device ID as the internal name by default, thus taking away the burden from the merchant to come up with a unique name.

Parameters:
internalName - : a unique internal name string.

getMobilityType

Merchant.MobilityTypeEnum getMobilityType()
Returns the mobility type of the merchant, whether his location is fixed or mobile.

Returns:
: MobilityTypeEnum object, FIXED or MOBILE

setMobilityType

void setMobilityType(Merchant.MobilityTypeEnum mobilityType)
method to set the mobile type for the merchant.

NOTE: currently, the SDK defaults the mobilityType to MOBILE.

Parameters:
mobilityType - : MobilityTypeEnum FIXED or MOBILE.

getAvailabilityType

Merchant.AvailabilityTypeEnum getAvailabilityType()
Returns the availability type of the merchant, whether he is open or closed to take any further payments.

Returns:
: AvailabilityTypeEnum object, OPEN or CLOSE

setAvailabilityType

void setAvailabilityType(Merchant.AvailabilityTypeEnum availabilityType)
method to set the availability type of the merchant.

NOTE: currently, the SDK defaults this to OPEN.

Parameters:
availabilityType - : AvailabilityTypeEnum object, OPEN or CLOSE
